intro: Callicarpa hitchcockii, commonly known as the red beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by vibrant red berries in the fall. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically green on top and lighter in color underneath. It thrives in partial to full sunlight and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping. The berries are not only visually striking but also attract birds and other wildlife, contributing to ecological diversity.
